issue.title: [Python] Create FileSystem bindings
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5494](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5494). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Now that we have a C++ filesystem API, it should be usable from Python as well.

comments.body:

`[~jorisvandenbossche]` I don't know what your priorities look like currently, but I think this would be a useful thing to tackle, especially as we will soon have a S3 filesystem implementation in C++.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5494?focusedCommentId=16913771) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I added to 0.15.0 optimistically. Having a minimal binding would be a nice thing, and probably not more than a couple of days' work

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5494?focusedCommentId=16914027) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
I would be happy to help here, although I will first need some more days to finish up the extension types work.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5494?focusedCommentId=16920953) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
